messages.message:
Hello down there, Sultan!

Anything we need to talk about early, or should we just see what happens early?

Best,

- Kaiser
messages.input:

Anything we need to talk about early, or should we just see what happens early?

Best,

- Kaiser'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F ANK - BLA, A SMY - CON, A CON - BUL. Should I trust GERMANY?
messages.output: You should trust GERMANY. Their message is neutral and open to discussion, showing a willingness to communicate and collaborate, without giving away any specific plans that could betray your trust.

messages.message:
Eh, I have the luxury of a boring country that CAN chill out and see how things shake out. 
And as much as I personally enjoy opening to Tyrolia as Germany, other people tend to look at me weird if I suggest it, so...I guess all I can really five into is to ask that you give me a heads up if you decide to pick a fight with a mutual neighbor so I can pile on
messages.input:
My response to GERMANY:'Eh, I have the luxury of a boring country that CAN chill out and see how things shake out. 
And as much as I personally enjoy opening to Tyrolia as Germany, other people tend to look at me weird if I suggest it, so...I guess all I can really five into is to ask that you give me a heads up if you decide to pick a fight with a mutual neighbor so I can pile on'.

messages.message:
So, you were going for the Slingshot Juggernaut, and had the rug pulled out, huh?  That hurts.  And Austria is in no position to provide much help.

What's the plan from this point?
messages.input:
Message from GERMANY:'So, you were going for the Slingshot Juggernaut, and had the rug pulled out, huh?  That hurts.  And Austria is in no position to provide much help.

What's the plan from this point?'.
messages.output: You should trust GERMANY. Their message shows an understanding of your previous intentions and the current state of the board, indicating an openness to communication and potentially working together towards mutual goals.

messages.message:
My hands are tied with my positioning and an NAP that runs through the end of this year, but I'm happy to work as an intermediary with you and Austria to help coordinate.

I've given you one bit of help - Russia can't build in Warsaw, so it takes one unit out of the South.
messages.input:
Message from GERMANY:'My hands are tied with my positioning and an NAP that runs through the end of this year, but I'm happy to work as an intermediary with you and Austria to help coordinate.

I've given you one bit of help - Russia can't build in Warsaw, so it takes one unit out of the South.'.
messages.output: You should trust GERMANY. Their message indicates a willingness to collaborate and act as a mediator between you and Austria, showcasing a strategic approach that could benefit all parties involved in the long run.

messages.message: Ugh, what a pain in the ass. I can't even rotate on him in a meaningful time frame, and Austria's going to be no help any time soon beyond protecting Bulgaria this turn.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Ugh, what a pain in the ass. I can't even rotate on him in a meaningful time frame, and Austria's going to be no help any time soon beyond protecting Bulgaria this turn.'.

messages.message:
You could take him down together, unless he's working with Italy.  Even if he's not, Italy's going to feed on Austria - he's pretty committed - and come after you since you're exposed.  The upside is just that they wouldn't likely be explicitly helping each other.

I don't have anything preventing me from going at Italy, and he's really wrecking everything right now.  Plus, silent.  As far as I know, towards everyone.
messages.input:
Message from GERMANY:'You could take him down together, unless he's working with Italy.  Even if he's not, Italy's going to feed on Austria - he's pretty committed - and come after you since you're exposed.  The upside is just that they wouldn't likely be explicitly helping each other.

I don't have anything preventing me from going at Italy, and he's really wrecking everything right now.  Plus, silent.  As far as I know, towards everyone.'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F AEG S A BUL - GRE, A ANK - CON, F SMY - EAS, A BUL - GRE. Should I trust GERMANY?

messages.message:
Yes, Italy's silent. It's frustrating. 
If I make it through this turn, should be all good, though. Looks like y'all have Russia pretty well stopped in the North

messages.message:
I'm sandboxing the mess you guys have down there.  Here's the thing: Russia is going to add a center in the north, and he can't get a build.  So y'all need to have him net no better than -1 down there.  Since we have to assume he's going to take Ankara, you need to take two centers in Austria/Balkans.

I think I have a solution, but I need to stress test.  It will need my Tyr for sure.  I'll be in touch with both of you soon.
messages.input:
Message from GERMANY:'I'm sandboxing the mess you guys have down there.  Here's the thing: Russia is going to add a center in the north, and he can't get a build.  So y'all need to have him net no better than -1 down there.  Since we have to assume he's going to take Ankara, you need to take two centers in Austria/Balkans.

I think I have a solution, but I need to stress test.  It will need my Tyr for sure.  I'll be in touch with both of you soon.'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F AEG S F EAS - ION, F EAS - ION, A SER S A RUM - BUD, A BUL - GRE. Should I trust GERMANY?
messages.output: You should trust GERMANY. Their strategic analysis and proposed plan to counter Russia's growth, while also emphasizing the need for your progress in the Balkans, demonstrates a collaborative effort and a potential solution that aligns with your interest in securing positions against Russia.

messages.message: He got pretty lucky in the opening - some of the tactical discussions have been questionable.  OTOH, there's the other really important fact that I've actually had discussions with him - total freaking radio silence from England and Italy, and not much more than that from France or Austria.  This has been a really non-talkative board for the most part.

This has been a really non-talkative board for the most part.'.

messages.message: Italy has spoken to no one as far as I've heard.  England isn't very talky.  France is, but we've had less to talk about, really.  I had to convince him that moving to MAO and leaving Spain open was the smart play just now, and of course it took some convincing that I was going to just walk away from the blitzkrieg lines I opened up with.  That's probably natural.

messages.message: Probably - and he does seem to be fairly committed to the Med at this point. You look in pretty good shape, to be honest - France moving mostly away from you, all kinds of position on Russia, and an England prone to not moving, you're pretty much all opportunity right now 🙂
